programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.desc: A Cardale schoolgirl begins behaving erratically, causing concern for her parents and provoking a professional difference of opinion between Will and Beth. While they're squabbling over the cause of her symptoms, Practice Manager Kim attends a school reunion where she meets a former teacher whose health problems give her a fresh insight into the case. Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd star

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth and Richard take over a country cottage for a couple of days, with unexpected results. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour departs for a new teaching job, leaving Clegg and Compo at a loose end now he is no longer around to drag them into his eccentric schemes. However, they do not realise an old friend is about to return to the village. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy makes an ill-advised attempt to establish long-distance communication with Compo and Clegg by investing in some walkie-talkies. However, it doesn't take long for one of the units to fall foul of a tractor. Long-running rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A brewery heiress appears to be the sole witness to the murder of a serial killer - but she was herself presumed dead 19 years previously. Dalziel assumes she is an imposter, until further research uncovers bad blood between the brothers currently running the family business. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The inclusion of a letter in a late actor's biography reopens an old case for the team - but reliving the past threatens to be too much for the widow who was accidentally responsible for his death. DAC Strickland's cocky nephew lends his assistance, but his affections for Sandra bring out the worst in Gerry and Brian. Dexter Fletcher guest stars

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Allie becomes increasingly worried about the number of customers she is losing to rival salon Blade Runner, and begins to suspect a traitor has given Mia an unfair advantage. Finn tries to charm her by ensuring she lands an important contract, and even offers to get a divorce if she'll agree to a relationship with him - a suggestion she throws back in his face. Sarah Parish and Amanda Holden star

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Jim Fenner is having a hard time adjusting to life on the other side of the bars as new wife Di desperately tries to secure his release. On the outside, Tina is struggling with freedom and starts a fire in a shopping centre in a bid to get back to the familiarity of G-Wing, but two newcomers to Larkhall are not so keen on doing time. Meanwhile, top dog Natalie continues to rule the roost, though it seems her dominant position can't go on for ever. Jack Ellis, Tracey Wilkinson, Victoria Bush and Dannielle Brent star

programme.desc: McAllister, still recuperating in hospital, vents her bitterness at Meadows, making it clear she blames him for Chandler's death, while Nixon puts her life on the line to prove her theory that Baxter is the serial killer

programme.desc: Trevor finally reveals his true intentions. Peggy, meanwhile, makes a decision that will affect both her and Sam, and the Brannings and Jacksons celebrate

programme.desc: Trevor manages to convince everyone that he's changed. Jim tries get out of having a flu jab. Paul is trying to sell dolls and dodges questions about Miss Webster

programme.desc: Charles answers to a fraud charge, Leo is left in bad health following his speedboat accident and a glamorous woman arrives in Tarrant

programme.desc: New trainee Andrew Attwood arrives at The Beeches full of high ideals, but soon causes friction. programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon decides to prevent any instances of unprofessional intimacy and jumps to conclusions when he discovers his receptionist in a cupboard. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth makes expensive vacation plans and discovers that voluntary church cleaning is certainly no holiday. Meanwhile, Rose ends up in a compromising position. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Mary Millar

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy are intrigued by some perfectly respectable men who turn up without their trousers, before they take part in an event sponsored by a village charity

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Feeling frustrated by his lack of fame, Foggy invents the sport of bicycle polo, convinced it will not only put his name in lights but prove a lucrative venture. Long-running comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Celebrity cook, Prunella Gladwell, brings her TV baking show to Great Slaughter. But the programme takes a sour turn when Gladys Tibbs is poisoned by her own cake

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: A frightening visit from a potential client puts a new case on the table and Cormoran Strike and Robin Ellacott set to work looking into reports of a strangled child. With their detective agency thriving, the duo are also recruited to investigate the blackmail of a government minister, with Robin going undercover in the House of Commons. The return of the crime thriller based on books by JK Rowling, starring Tom Burke and Holliday Grainger, with Robert Glenister and Robert Pugh

programme.desc: A jubilant Fenner is released from prison and it's not long before wife Di is making plans to start a family. Unfortunately for her, the ex-guard has other things on his mind - like blackmailing his way into the wing governor's job. The inmates push a reluctant Janine into reporting Natalie and Darlene's extortion racket, while Sylvia receives good news - and an unexpected admirer. Jack Ellis, Tracey Wilkinson and Nicola Stapleton star

programme.desc: A virtuoso violinist baffles Lovejoy by asking him to help pull off an elaborate con involving a fake Stradivarius - so he enlists an expert to find out what is going on. Whimsical drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.title: New Tricks

programme.title: Bad Girls

Whitney's first day back on the market is tough as Mother's Day is the big topic of discussion. Jean tries to bring an end to the feud between Kat and Stacey. Keanu and Chelsea go on a date at the Vic, but when his back is turned, Ravi slithers over to flirt with flattered Chelsea

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. Guitar expert Julyan Wallis is presented with a cherished 1960s jazz guitar which has been left in a broken state for decades. Meanwhile, wood restoration expert Will Kirk has his work cut out when is presented with a handmade veneered card table. Later, the experts turn their attention to bookmakers bag and a Victorian clockwork pigeon

programme.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
programme.desc: In 2021, 33-year-old mother of three Christine McGuinness discovered she was autistic, and for the first time her life began to make sense. There are thousands of women in the UK who have been battling with undiagnosed autism for decades. Christine sets out on a journey of self-discovery, asking why it took so long before she received a diagnosis and the impact it has had on her life. She also asks how many other women out there have been let down too and what can be done to improve the lives of autistic women and girls? She meets with other women who have had similar experiences

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim lands himself a role as an extra in a period biopic about a famous disabled musician. When some campaigners kick up a fuss about the star lead - James Norton - not being disabled, Tim is recast as the lead in a knee-jerk reaction to avoid media backlash. The bosses are so concerned with optics surrounding disability, they completely disregard the authenticity of the film - Tim doesn't even have the right disability and aside from that, cannot act to save his life. Chaos therefore ensues as he brings the production to its knees. Tim Renkow stars in this comedy a cerebral palsy sufferer who uses his condition to get away with saying what others are unable to

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim falls foul of the local drug dealer after accidentally walking off with a load of her weed. His skin is saved when she realises that as a disabled man he is an ideal candidate to become an unlikely drug mule. After getting the gig, he soon realises it isn't as fun as it looks on TV. Meanwhile, Ruth is left to look after a care dog that Tim's been sent by Mom. Snuffles is way too good at his job for Ruth's liking and she sets out to educate him on what being a carer is really about. Comedy, starring Tim Renkow and Sharon Rooney

Chelsea is not best pleased to hear Keanu has agreed to work for Sharon, but Ravi is delighted by the discord, seeing it as a way to manoeuvre his way in

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The diving team get a late call from a boat in peril. A missing lifeboat cannister means a ferry is unable to sail, causing chaos for the passengers that use the service for their daily commute. It's a needle-in-a-haystack hunt in near-zero visibility - and to make matters worse, local leisure cruisers create imminent danger for the diver underwater

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, who's front of house. It's the Bikers' job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes from their favourite cookery books, explaining their value as social documents that reveal a great deal about people and what they ate. The duo meet Ivan Day, who has one of the most extensive collections of recipe books in the UK, and share stories of renowned food writers such as Elizabeth David and Isabella Beeton

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: Wildlife in America's mountain regions, including the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada, areas infamous for extremes of temperature from freezing winters to scorching summers. The programme examines the survival strategies employed by animals including black bears, pikas and bison, as well as parasitic plants. Plus, a look at the challenges faced by these region's human inhabitants, including ranchers leading their cattle on 70-mile journeys

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents another selection of choice moments from the long-running series. The show's specialists recall the difficulties that arose while recording episodes in Europe, and Andy McConnell remembers a glass artist with a difference

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores Abergavenny food festival in Wales, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In St Agnes, the crew is involved in a race against time to rescue two young men. They are reported to be struggling in the water near a notorious headland known as Tubby's Head. In Whitby, North Yorkshire, Leah is training to be the station's first female helm, and her skills are put to the test when she is called out to rescue a walker who's fallen and injured her leg on inaccessible rocks by the seal colony at Ravenscar

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Northern Ireland serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. Their vegan starters include a celebration of mushrooms inspired by the Northern Ireland animated film Wolfwalkers and an artichoke tart playing tribute to the Gruffalo trail in Belfast. Among the fish dishes are two based on Puffin Rock - one with pan-fried cod, the other an elevated version of fish, chips and curry sauce - as well as a sea trout with buttermilk sauce celebrating the illustrations in The Fog Catcher's Daughter

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which co-presenters Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha, along with others of Jewish and Palestinian heritage, explore how their families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They begin by meeting a father and son who follow in the footsteps of their ancestor, who became caught up in Israel's War of Independence, and a woman whose grandmother survived one of the most notorious episodes of the Nakba

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: A selection of highlights from the comedy panel game, in which things just didn't go according to plan. Hosted by Sandi Toksvig, with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Having just signed his first record deal, Dave fights to push his own creative vision - in this case, a brand new and controversial track called Jail, which he has earmarked as his first ever release but which his record company strongly objects to

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: While making a video he hopes will propel him to global success, Dave is forced to face reality as the project threatens to implode. Comedy about a neurotic suburbanite convinced he is destined to be a rap star, starring Dave Burd, with GaTa and Andrew Santino

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the south east of Australia from Canberra, the seat of government, to the multi-ethnic heart of its second largest city, Melbourne. Floating above Canberra in a hot-air balloon, Michael sees how Australia's 'Bush Capital' was planned in the early 20th century and tours the nation's Parliament. He takes the high-speed train nearly 300 miles south west, to arrive in Melbourne at the head of Port Philip Bay on Australia's south-eastern coast

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the holiday makers who arrived at their hotels only to discover they'd been closed for years

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing £7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team are charged with clearing abandoned boats causing an eyesore and navigational hazard in a picturesque part of the river. Facing the threat of dangerous chemicals, metal boats and lots of mud the team must chase the tide in what is one of the most unusual daily commutes. But when disaster strikes, the divers are left stranded into the night on one of their most challenging jobs yet

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Take a Hike

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: A journey along America's West coast. The programme examines how the landscape is shaped by the Pacific Ocean as well as powerful forces beneath ground, particularly along the San Andreas Fault. The programme also visits the warm and sheltered waters of the Sea of Cortez, where animals including blue whales gather, and discovers how a small community in America's westernmost point have a unique relationship with grey whales

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Antique-silver specialists Alastair Dickenson and Ian Pickford learn the art of the silversmith, and Marc Allum praises a notable piece of 20th-century design. Presented by Fiona Bruce

Turning up out of the hundreds of bags and boxes is some Aboriginal art and a 1920s tennis racket, which antiques experts James Lewis and Caroline Hawley are only too happy to appraise. Plus, presenter Paul Martin finds out about the life of footballer Billy Wright, one of the city's most famous sons

programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman explore Ballycastle's Ould Lammas Fair, finding out how Venezuelan street food made it to Northern Ireland. They also learn how to make money go further when it comes to meat and Colin introduces Edith to Yellowman and dulce. Ryan Hand is in Armagh on the hunt for a healthy ready meal and chef Suzie Lee finds a delicious fishy surprise in Lough Neagh.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: At Beachy Head, the Eastbourne crew have to deal with a base jumper's disastrous takeoff. Just along the Sussex coast in Newhaven, a man faces a race against time as he suffers a seizure on board a tall ship. At Loch Ness, a Second World War sea plane runs into mechanical trouble, and in Rhyl, a dog chasing seagulls into the sea bites off more than she can chew

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Northern Ireland chefs serve up their mains and desserts, competing for a place at a banquet celebrating animation and illustration. Their creative offerings include pies inspired by the Wombles and Aesop's Fables, as well as a chocolate soil, milk sorbet and jelly worm celebrating the series Earthworm Jim and a pudding based on Guess How Much I Love You? - a book written and illustrated in Northern Ireland

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Two years ago, patient Karl sustained a brain injury after falling downstairs, as a result of which surgeons had to leave a portion of his skull missing to stop his brain from swelling. Today, neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew intends to rebuild his skull - but at the moment, a hospital bed cannot be found. Meanwhile, consultant Sheila Fraser removes a tumour believed to be the size of a football from a patient's abdomen and a seven-year-old has metal pins removed from his legs, now his broken limbs have healed

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Man Like Mobeen star Guz Khan hosts the stand-up showcase recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. Also on the bill are Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Rhys James

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Betty Boothroyd: Call Me Madam
programme.desc: Michael Cockerell profiles the former speaker of the House of Commons Betty Boothroyd, who died in February. First broadcast in 2000, the film examines her political and private lives, and includes archive footage, interviews with colleagues and anecdotes

programme.title: The Elephant Man (1980)
programme.desc: In 1884, ambitious young surgeon Frederick Treves is intrigued by a sideshow freak billed as the Elephant Man. He finds, behind the disfigured exhibit, an intelligent person called John Merrick, whose rehabilitation he undertakes, with the severely deformed man's life being transformed by the friendship that develops between the two. Fact-based drama directed by David Lynch, starring John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller and Freddie Jones

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: Precious items of clothing, a tea trolley, some accordions and a propeller are among the items remade into beautiful and functional items. Presented by Sabrina Grant

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr set about renovating the bathrooms. Amanda is unconvinced about Alan's bidet and Alan tries to veto Amanda's disco ball installation - but neither will back down on their vision. In Alan's quest to stay true to Sicilian culture, he treats Amanda to a visit to Marsala's salt pans for a unique spa experience. Amanda's dreams of a roll-top bath come crashing down as Alan sets her the task of recycling the apartment's existing one, but karma kicks in as his DIY skills are pushed to the limit with a masterclass in floor tiling

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford go behind the scenes at one of the UK's biggest airports to find out just how much goes missing. Plus, expert advice on how to keep tabs on precious holiday cargo. Globe-trotter Simon Calder reveals why Luxembourg may be a cheaper break than imagined

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian presents the show from Blackpool's newest museum, while the teams are shopping nearby in an antiques centre with the help of experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha and Phil continue on their antiquing adventure. While Natasha uncovers an early silver sandwich box and a Scottish spirit kettle, Phil finds a Victorian fish service

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to a farmer's field in Rutland to examine evidence of a Roman barn conversion, featuring a three-room spa, including underfloor and in-wall central heating. She also finds out about the excavation of one of Henry VIII's lost forts in Hull, and hears from a team that discovered stunning 10,000-year-old hunting tools near Scarborough

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create classic puddings and explore the history and traditions behind Britain's favourite desserts. They also take part in the world black-pudding throwing competition in Lancashire

programme.title: Land of the Lost Wolves
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan presents a two-part programme documenting the return of wolves to the snowy peaks of Washington's Cascade Mountains. He charts the fortunes of first pack to live in the north-west of America in 70 years after all but being wiped out across the country

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Highlights of the long-running TV series, featuring furniture expert Lennox Cato offering tips on collecting, and Penny Brittain learning about textile conservation. Presented by Fiona Bruce

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon assess items at Margam Country Park in South Wales, while presenter Paul Martin visits the birthplace of one of his heroes, a Welshman who took Hollywood by storm

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas test their general knowledge skills in the week's penultimate edition

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman explore the food festival in Cockermouth in Cumbria, meeting passionate food producers and getting tips on homemade pitta bread from a MasterChef winner. Food journalist Leyla Kazim reveals the secrets of tomato growing and heads to Northumbria in search of the best local fish at the best price. Baker Briony May Williams finds out why Cumbria is the home of sticky toffee pudding

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: On Ireland's south-east coast, the three RNLI crews at Dunmore East, Kilmore Quay and Rosslare battle to save a cargo ship that has lost all power and is drifting towards rocks. In Hoylake, on the Wirral, a vast multi-agency effort is required to rescue a mother and daughter who have got stuck in the mud and, 65 miles to the west, in the coastal village of Porthdinllaen, the crew respond to a mayday call from a yacht five miles out in the Irish Sea that is requesting an immediate medical evacuation

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from Northern Ireland go head to head and cook their six-course menus again, hoping to impress judges Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona and Ed Gamble with their creations. The pair will also have to dazzle guest judge Oliver Jeffers, the award-winning author and artist, as he helps to decide which chef will make it to the final

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: In the final part of the story, we hear from the bomber, how he came to plant the bombs on the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, and the measures he took to escape New Zealand after the attack. He and another suspect reveal the origins of the mission - the French government convincing them that the KGB had infiltrated Greenpeace

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: The latest candidate to leave the competition joins Tom Allen to talk about their time on the show, while a panel of celebrity fans and business experts give their thoughts on the unfortunate entrepreneur's progress

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: After winning a Grand Slam, the star players of Wales are eyeing up the ultimate test - a British and Irish Lions tour against the All Blacks - but what will happen in New Zealand will change the life of the prodigiously talented outside half, Barry John

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Two years ago, patient Karl sustained a brain injury after falling downstairs, as a result of which surgeons had to leave a portion of his skull missing to stop his brain from swelling. Today, neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew intends to rebuild his skull - but at the moment, a hospital bed cannot be found. Meanwhile, consultant Sheila Fraser removes a tumour believed to be the size of a football from a patient's abdomen and a seven-year-old has metal pins removed from his legs, now his broken limbs have healed

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After six months at sea on its first operational deployment, HMS Queen Elizabeth departs the Pacific for the long voyage home. After crossing the Arabian Sea, the ship stops at Duqm in Oman to replenish stores, before proceeding up the Red Sea, through the Suez canal and into the eastern Mediterranean. An F35 jet on a routine launch loses power at a critical moment and the pilot has to eject, and HMS Queen Elizabeth launches a search and rescue mission to locate the airman

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford investigate consumers' disastrous holidays and travel troubles - from caravans that didn't live up to the marketing material, to world cruises that proved tricky to insure. Plus, top tips on how to travel safely

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fatemah has still never taken a driving test despite learning to drive for eight years. It has fallen to the 25-year-old's adoring but nerve-shattered dad Akil to instruct her. But as Scarlett Moffatt's experts discover, the driving may not be the problem

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending his first in the former mining village of St Day

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer and explorer Paul Rose heads for Wensleydale as he sets out to explore the region, starting in the small town of Hawes, where locals now run many of their own services, including the buses. Paul checks out why cycling is so popular in the Dales and tries to get to the top of the Buttertubs Pass. Along the way he meets a family of dormice and spends time with a man who looks after one of the area's most imposing castles

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Luke finds himself in the unusual position of spending a night at home alone. Why have both his wife and mistress deserted him at the same time? Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Historian Simon Schama continues his epic journey through time with a look at the 18th century. Renowned for being a period of economic growth that laid the foundations for the modern parliamentary state, it was also a time of uncertainty as the Jacobite claim to the throne threatened to undermine the progress of new forces in British society

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc: The final instalment reveals how, in the late 1970s, corruption within the City of London's CID had grown out of control - and how Operation Countryman was launched in response

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC film-maker Natalie Hewit spent three months in Antarctica following the work of the everyday heroes who have been challenged to move a vital polar research station, Halley VI. Built on the Brunt Ice Shelf, it sits far beyond the Antarctic shoreline, but a crevasse in the surrounding ice threatens to send the station adrift

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The story of one of the world's biggest white-collar heists, which saw a Malaysian wealth fund looted of $3.5billion and involved government corruption at the highest level, abuse of power and international money laundering. With little to go on, investigative reporters from the New York Times, Wall Street Journal and Hollywood Reporter retrace the dirty money, via real-estate deals and movie financing including The Wolf of Wall Street, back to the top echelons of the Malaysian government. The Prime Minister and his inner circle are implicated, assets are frozen, money is seized and the Malaysian people fight back

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade concludes his journey by exploring southern Africa. In Mozambique, he discovers that a declining tourist trade has benefited wildlife and explores local attitudes to disability. Moving on to South Africa, he investigates how much life has changed in the 25 years since the downfall of apartheid. His journey ends in Zimbabwe, a country that is still struggling economically despite having vast quantities of gold

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending his first in the former mining village of St Day

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Historian Simon Schama continues his epic journey through time with a look at the 18th century. Renowned for being a period of economic growth that laid the foundations for the modern parliamentary state, it was also a time of uncertainty as the Jacobite claim to the throne threatened to undermine the progress of new forces in British society

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Cornwall's county town, Truro, heading to the historic estate of Trewithen, whose gardens were stocked from China by professional plant hunters commissioned by its owner. The Atlantic Coast branch line carries Michael north to Newquay, where he discovers a pioneering surfer and braves the waves on a belly board. In the nearby village of St Mawgan, Michael is introduced to the ancient Cornish sport of 'wrassling', which surged in popularity between the wars as part of a Cornish Celtic revival

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer Paul Rose heads for Swaledale, joining farmers who look after rare upland hay meadows and enters the cake-making contest at Muker Show using a pressure cooker he has taken on a climb of Mount Everest. Paul also goes underground to try and find rare industrial artefacts left behind by lead miners in the 19th century and meets All Creatures Great and Small star Peter Davison

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a look at animals with impressive communication skills, discovering how white-throated sparrows use song to attract mates and the complex vocabulary of prairie dogs. The programme reveals how dolphins are able to address each other by name and chimpanzees use sign language, and also reveals species that communicate using ultrasound, vibrations and parts of the light spectrum beyond the ability of human sense to process

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy talks about the impact of Anne Boleyn on Henry VIII's affections, uncovering private moments that were reported by eyewitnesses or recorded in historical documents. The key moments during their marriage are recreated, as Anne falls from favour in court and is eventually executed, despite protestations of innocence regarding the rumours of her infidelity. As soon as Anne is dead, Henry marries Jane Seymour, who fulfils her most important role as Queen - giving birth to the healthy son that Henry has craved for so long

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: The story of Henry VIII's marriages continues. The King is embroiled with the Reformation, and after the execution of Anne Boleyn he marries the kind and loving gentlewoman Jane Seymour. Will she provide him with the peace and comfort he needs - and more importantly, a male heir? Starring Keith Michell and Anne Stallybrass. From 1970

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Henry has been a widower for two years but political diplomacy and Thomas Cromwell urge the King to choose Anne of Cleves. Will the match prove a triumph or a disaster? Keith Michell, Elvi Hale and Wolfe Morris star. From 1970

programme.title: Stephen: The Murder That Changed a Nation
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 1993 death of Stephen Lawrence, beginning with a look at events leading up to his murder and the police investigation that follows. As the suspects remain free, tip-offs from the community make his parents, Doreen and Neville, wonder why the authorities are not making arrests

programme.title: Stephen: The Murder That Changed a Nation
programme.desc: The second police investigation reveals shocking surveillance footage of the gang alleged to have killed Stephen, and with the help of their lawyer Imran Khan, Doreen and Neville Lawrence launch the first private murder prosecution in 150 years. However, when it collapses, questions about the failure of the first police investigation mount

programme.title: Stephen: The Murder That Changed a Nation
programme.desc: Final part of the documentary exploring Stephen Lawrence's murder and the subsequent police investigation. The public inquiry leads to a change in the law meaning the suspects can be retried. Detective Clive Driscoll takes on the case, and with the help of advances in forensic science he arrests Gary Dobson and David Norris. But as justice seems to have finally been done, revelations that the police spied on the Lawrence family begin to surface

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Bodmin en route to Totnes, as he explores the West Country from St Ives to Salisbury Plain. Out on the rugged moor, Michael hears how the celebrated author Daphne du Maurier captivated readers between the wars with her tales of smuggling at the Jamaica Inn. In Devon, Michael takes the plunge at Plymouth's beautiful art deco Tinside Lido, while at Ivybridge, he boards a vehicle like no other to cross the causeway to Burgh Island, where a 1930s playboy built a splendid art deco party palace

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer Paul Rose's trip concludes in Wharfedale, where he talks to some of the women whose story inspired the film Calendar Girls, finds out why bats are under threat in the area and meets families from inner-city Bradford who are having their first Dales experience

programme.title: Michael Caine: Acting in Film
programme.desc: The Oscar-winner gives a masterclass on the craft of acting for the movie camera, conducting a workshop with five actors using scenes from some of his films. From 1987

programme.title: The Ipcress File (1965)
programme.desc: An intelligence agent investigating the kidnap and brainwashing of Britain's most renowned scientists unpicks a complex chain of connections and high-level intrigue, while detecting evidence of double-dealing and counter-espionage. Spy thriller based on Len Deighton's novel, starring Michael Caine, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Nigel Green

programme.title: Funeral in Berlin (1966)
programme.desc: Former crook and disreputable spy Harry Palmer has to carefully engineer the defection of a Russian officer responsible for safeguarding vital military secrets - but the mission proves less than straightforward. Cold War thriller and the second film to feature Len Deighton's character, starring Michael Caine, Eva Renzi, Oscar Homolka, Paul Hubschmid and Guy Doleman

programme.desc: Jamie dreams of becoming a fisherman, working alongside his dad on their boat, the Silver Queen. He lives on the Lizard Peninsula, the UK’s most southerly point. Over the course of a year, we discover what it is like to live as part of a close family and community in a tiny traditional Cornish coastal village. We see how Jamie’s life is impacted by the ebb and flow of the seasons as the tourists come and go, and the winter storms roll in stopping the boats from heading out. He continues to learn the family business and explore what the future might hold for the next generation of Cornish fishermen. programme.desc: The team re-investigates the case of osteopath Danny Dyke. After the 30-year-old went missing in 1994, it was discovered that he was acting as a drug courier between London and Swansea. When his body was not found, he was presumed dead and a rumour quickly spread that he had been murdered. A remarkable chain of events led the police to a hillside near Swansea, where they located a fragment of bone that became key in the investigation

programme.title: Jerk

When some campaigners kick up a fuss about the star lead - James Norton - not being disabled, Tim is recast as the lead in a knee-jerk reaction to avoid media backlash. The bosses are so concerned with optics surrounding disability, they completely disregard the authenticity of the film - Tim doesn't even have the right disability and aside from that, cannot act to save his life. Chaos therefore ensues as he brings the production to its knees. Tim Renkow stars in this comedy a cerebral palsy sufferer who uses his condition to get away with saying what others are unable to

programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of Delyth Prothero, Wales's most successful athletics manager, through the eyes of some Welsh greats including Colin Jackson, Iwan Thomas, Jamie Baulch and Matt Elias

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Builder Garry has been learning to drive for 30 years, and relies on wife Jeany to take him everywhere. Following an accident, Garry now has to pass to help her. Garry's battle is even tougher as his dyslexia makes following signs difficult, but Jeany is there with constant advice. During their five days at Scarlett's Driving School, there are near-misses on roundabouts and marital squabbles

programme.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
programme.desc: In 2021, 33-year-old mother of three Christine McGuinness discovered she was autistic, and for the first time her life began to make sense. There are thousands of women in the UK who have been battling with undiagnosed autism for decades. Christine sets out on a journey of self-discovery, asking why it took so long before she received a diagnosis and the impact it has had on her life. She also asks how many other women out there have been let down too and what can be done to improve the lives of autistic women and girls? She meets with other women who have had similar experiences

programme.desc: A weekly digest of stories and in-depth interviews about what is happening in Wales and why it matters

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim falls foul of the local drug dealer after accidentally walking off with a load of her weed. His skin is saved when she realises that as a disabled man he is an ideal candidate to become an unlikely drug mule. After getting the gig, he soon realises it isn't as fun as it looks on TV. Meanwhile, Ruth is left to look after a care dog that Tim's been sent by Mom. Snuffles is way too good at his job for Ruth's liking and she sets out to educate him on what being a carer is really about. Comedy, starring Tim Renkow and Sharon Rooney

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-investigates the case of osteopath Danny Dyke. After the 30-year-old went missing in 1994, it was discovered that he was acting as a drug courier between London and Swansea. When his body was not found, he was presumed dead and a rumour quickly spread that he had been murdered. A remarkable chain of events led the police to a hillside near Swansea, where they located a fragment of bone that became key in the investigation

programme.title: Debate Night
programme.desc: Stephen Jardine presents live from Edinburgh as three candidates vying for SNP Leadership and the next First Minister make their case

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: Mud (2012)
programme.desc: Two boys exploring an island on the Mississippi discover a fugitive has made his home there. He tells them he is on the run from bounty hunters after killing a man, and needs their help to be reunited with his lost love. As they ferry messages to the woman in question, the youngsters are forced to come to terms with the complexity of adult relationships. Drama, starring Matthew McConaughey and Reese Witherspoon

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
programme.desc: In 2021, 33-year-old mother of three Christine McGuinness discovered she was autistic, and for the first time her life began to make sense. Christine sets out on a journey of self-discovery, asking why it took so long before she received a diagnosis and the impact it has had on her life. programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim lands himself a role as an extra in a period biopic about a famous disabled musician. When some campaigners kick up a fuss about the star lead - James Norton - not being disabled, Tim is recast as the lead in a knee-jerk reaction to avoid media backlash. The bosses are so concerned with optics surrounding disability, they completely disregard the authenticity of the film - Tim doesn't even have the right disability and aside from that, cannot act to save his life. Chaos therefore ensues as he brings the production to its knees. Tim Renkow stars in this comedy a cerebral palsy sufferer who uses his condition to get away with saying what others are unable to

Denise is desperate to set Keanu and Chelsea up on another date, Alfie is shocked by Freddie's money-making scheme and Emma undoes all Jay's good work with Lola and Lexi

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Stephen Dempster investigates the use of plastic bullets on the streets and claims that the government knew of their potential to kill. Spotlight speaks to the soldiers who fired them, the families who lost loved ones and those still searching for answers

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: The trainees are just one step from the final, but one of them has been keeping a secret that will change everything

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Jayne Middlemiss, Neil Delamere, Harpreet Kaur and Amar Latif are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Duran Duran, the Vikings, The Wolf of Wall Street and Sam Cooke

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates are tasked with creating and branding a new dog food before pitching to major retailers. In the kitchen one team argues over the recipe for their signature dish, while on the other side a premium product fails to deliver. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar assesses their collective efforts and removes another hopeful from the process

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Stephen Mangan, Charlotte Church, Sam Quek, Nihal Arthanayake, Kate Humble, Rosie Ramsey and Keith Brymer Jones

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Two police officers are threatened by a man with a gun and a young call handler de-escalates a situation in which a man threatens his family member with a knife

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Folkestone, Kent, Jacqui Joseph meets a fellow designer with clever ideas for making the most of a quirky, former coach-house cottage. Martin Roberts heads to Portsmouth to see what can be done with a two-bedroom ground-floor flat whose layout is less than ideal, and Dion Dublin visits a three-bedroom semi near Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, which comes with a massive bonus

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp invites two teams to tour Detling Antique and Vintage Fair in Kent in search of items to take to auction in the hope of making the greater profit. They are helped on their endeavours by experts Caroline Hawley and Raj Bisram. Away from the contest, Natasha has a mystery item up her sleeve

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma and Sid encounter an issue with the dads' group. Luca helps Jamie buy a bed and Dafydd tries to celebrate St David's Day despite Jimmi's best efforts to spoil it

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Aided by a rich catalogue of BBC home and garden archive, Jay offers tips on ways to tackle outstanding tasks and encourages viewers to become self-sufficient in their own homes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson travels to the Leicestershire countryside to help a couple with a £750,000 budget find a rural home close to their family. While exploring the county's bricks and mortar, Jules pays a visit to a beautiful arts and crafts cottage preserved as a time capsule from a bygone era

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha and Phil continue their journey to Glasgow where they find some French candlesticks, an Italian paperweight and a combo lot of weighty farm troughs

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Four friends - Martin, Thomas, Andrew, and Santino - try to find the right path across the bridge in a bid to win some cash. Game show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio. Presented by Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay and Emma clash over their different approaches to Lola's situation - Emma wants him to stop being so over-protective, but Jay is adamant Lola mustn't do too much. Whitney's first day back on the market is tough as Mother's Day is the big topic of discussion. Jean tries to bring an end to the feud between Kat and Stacey. Keanu and Chelsea go on a date at the Vic, but when his back is turned, Ravi slithers over to flirt with flattered Chelsea

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. Guitar expert Julyan Wallis is presented with a cherished 1960s jazz guitar which has been left in a broken state for decades. Meanwhile, wood restoration expert Will Kirk has his work cut out when is presented with a handmade veneered card table. Later, the experts turn their attention to bookmakers bag and a Victorian clockwork pigeon

programme.title: Christine McGuinness: Unmasking My Autism
programme.desc: In 2021, 33-year-old mother of three Christine McGuinness discovered she was autistic, and for the first time her life began to make sense. There are thousands of women in the UK who have been battling with undiagnosed autism for decades. Christine sets out on a journey of self-discovery, asking why it took so long before she received a diagnosis and the impact it has had on her life. She also asks how many other women out there have been let down too and what can be done to improve the lives of autistic women and girls? She meets with other women who have had similar experiences

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Cleveland Cavaliers v Philadelphia 76ers. Coverage of the Eastern Conference encounter at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse, joining in progress 10 minutes after the tip-off

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Famous faces from across the BBC offer support as Gethin Jones begins his 24-hour Strictly Come Dancing challenge for Comic Relief

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces and ask for viewers' help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A Gloucestershire police officer responds to a gas leak and performs CPR on a teenage boy. Cameras follow Humberside Fire and Rescue on the busiest time of the year - Bonfire Night

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph explore a three-bedroom semi in the West Midlands, a first-floor flat in south-east London and a terraced house in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The red and blue teams are on the hunt for profits in Long Marston, Warwickshire, with help from experts Charles Hanson and Nick Hall. Presenter Eric Knowles monitors the contest and also pays a visit to Birmingham Assay Office to discover how hallmarking works in the 21st century

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Luca comes clean to Jamie and Sid fails to get through to Damien. Nina helps a patient whose carer is ill

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay demonstrates how to make a closet organiser, Danny Clark gives a lesson in hedge trimming and Alyse Folwer shows how easy it is to grow cucumbers

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is on a property hunting mission with a couple who have a £750,000 budget to make a move from the Essex coast to the Suffolk countryside. Aside from the hunt, Jonnie ventures into fields of golden rapeseed to find out how the oil of this humble plant has fast become a store cupboard staple

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Philip Serrell continue seeking items of value, on a tour of East Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway. Natasha picks up a silver tea caddy and a first edition Virginia Woolf collection of books. Philip discovers just why collecting ancient musical instruments was a status symbol in the 19th century. He also finds a beautiful watercolour by a local artist, but is distracted by some very tasty looking homemade scones

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, challenging family members Emmanuel, Michael, Debbie and Vivian to find a safe path across the bridge, choosing the truths and avoiding the lies

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Rylan present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack tries to talk to Whitney about having a memorial for Peach, but she proves evasive - made even worse when Lily has a health scare. Heartbroken Jay cannot believe Lola thinks he is capable of cheating. Chelsea is not best pleased to hear Keanu has agreed to work for Sharon, but Ravi is delighted by the discord, seeing it as a way to manoeuvre his way in

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An Olympic athlete hopes for a podium finish for her figure skating clothing brand, and a vacuum attachment to combat dust from drilling aims to suck in the cash of Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Plus, a coffee company couple hope they won't be on the receiving end of a roasting for their pitch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: Some familiar faces return to interrogate the business plans of the final five and there's tears, turmoil and tough talking as the candidates battle to back their statements and ideas. However, a deep dive into their proposals reveal fictitious figures, crazy concepts and absurd ambitions. For at least one hopeful it's the end of the road as a disgruntled Lord Sugar shows them the door

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Warrington, Cheshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: The Chronicles of Erne
programme.desc: Ahead of the Erne Pike Classic, brothers Eddie and Frankie Roofe scout for prize-winning fishing spots for their mysterious and elusive prey. Nature writer Dara McAnulty explores the fascinating world of mushrooms

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The UK has the largest regulated online gambling sector in the world, and now with the market seeing more and more online products and games of all kinds, people can gamble using their mobile phones and from the comfort of their own homes, at work or even on the go. Now eighteen years on from the last major gambling legislation, the Government is consulting on new reform to gambling laws, but will it be enough to protect consumers? Paul Brand examines the devastating impact gambling can have on people's lives, and speaks to the people coping with the impact of gambling harms and hears from those running Britain's treatment services as they struggle with rising demand

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Sian Williams is joined by dietician Linia Patel to investigate how low-fat sausages stack up in terms of calories, nutrition and cost. Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good diet is road-tested by 49-year-old accountant Steve - will the Michelin-starred chef's calorie counting and low carb home-cooked meal plan make Steve's love of beer and takeaways a thing of the past? programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team is given two days and a $20,000 budget to remove a 10-metre steel-hulled yacht from Cockburn Beach in Western Australia. The problem is the boat is buried deep in the sand and is a danger to beach goers. Heavy machinery specialist Ryan is going to use his monster excavator to try and get the job done, but there's a catch - to make the budget work, Luke needs Ryan to be done and dusted in 24 hours.

programme.title: Magnum, PI

programme.title: Minder

With a gross of red light bulbs in his boot, the evidence seems compelling, and even Ray begins to doubt his uncle's innocence. Nevertheless, the loyal nephew sets out to track down the so-called Goodtime garage to provide corroboration. Lighthearted drama, with George Cole and Gary Webster

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. The gang and Mr. Bradshaw work together to get to the bottom of this space alien mystery and figure out what this alien is really after - championship rings or giant doughnuts

programme.title: Buck and Buddy

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Throughout this winter a member of an ambulance crew has secretly filmed his daily work. The covert film vividly records him and his colleagues struggling to save lives despite lengthening ambulance delays, and overwhelmed A&E departments that stack patients in corridors without the hospital medical staff available to care for them. The footage and additional case studies uncovered by this programme's makers illustrate how the NHS's apparent failure to properly deal with emergency calls is causing suffering, long-term harm and possibly needless death

programme.title: Tool Club
programme.desc: Presenter Kevin Duala and team members Max McMurdo, Julia Miller-Osborn and Jess Grizzle head to Preston, to work against the clock turning an unloved space into a bright allotment for the Stanley Grange residential community. Jess is joined by Jane and her granddaughter Sophie to jazz up some plant pots, and Julia encourages DIY novices Claire and Catherine to brighten up a trellis

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In France, the alpaca farmers take the herd to a chateau and the gîtes get their first guests. In Spain, the padel tennis club flourishes and in Italy, a project nears completion

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Alice in Wonderland-themed Hatter's Hotel in Skegness, Lincolnshire. Husband-and-wife team Dee and Gary reckon their unique B&B experience will have their guests grinning like Cheshire cats - and the literary décor certainly proves a hit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee nurse Brilliance is the fourth person to host in the West Yorkshire town of Huddersfield. She hopes to give her guests an evening that they will never forget as she brings a taste of her native Zimbabwe. There's traditional Zulu dancing, lashings of salad cream and a rainbow-coloured main course, but whether it will be enough to bag her the £1,000 prize remains to be seen

programme.title: The Simpsons

Recovering from a broken leg, lurcher Manuel is potentially paired with paramedic Luke and partner Kath, while Lauren considers a life in the company of Winnie the Lhasa

programme.title: Nazanin
programme.desc: Observational documentary about Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the British-Iranian charity worker arrested at Tehran airport in 2016 and accused of spying. Her husband Richard juggled a media and political campaign to free his wife while raising their daughter Gabriella alone. He knew then that his wife's detention was deeply connected to the complicated and toxic diplomatic relationship between Britain and Iran and to an unpaid debt going back half a century. Five years in the making, this film includes never-before-seen material captured by Nazanin herself

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business

programme.desc: Ben spends a week in Dorset with former paratrooper Chris who, despite losing nearly everything, has spent the last five years walking the UK's coastline. Ben joins Chris and his faithful dog companion, Jet, 27,000 miles into their walk, and also meets Chris' partner and fellow hiker, Kate. programme.title: Who Killed Billie-Jo?
programme.desc: Examining the unsolved case of 13-year-old Billie-Jo Jenkins, who was murdered on the patio of her seaside home in 1997. programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: In June 1985, TWA flight 847 made a routine stop-off in Athens, Greece. Its destination was Rome, but that changed after armed Lebanese militia boarded the plane. Against the backdrop of the Middle East conflict, the terrorists had one objective in mind - the release of hundreds of Islamic prisoners detained in Israel. Seizing the US airliner shortly after take-off, the passengers and crew - including singer Demis Roussos - endured a three-day ordeal involving a stream of landings across various airports. This documentary recalls their experiences

programme.title: The Blitz: Britain on Fire

They focus on Margaret Johnson, a mother of six who had been bombed out of one home, and Mary Lawson, a promising film star in 1940s Britain. programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: It's the height of summer in Dalby and Cropton Forests and the inhabitants are making the most of the abundance the warm weather provides. The young beaver kits bond with the rest of the family as they learn how to groom and chew through bark, two important skills they need to master. This episode also looks back at the history of the Lumberjills, the affectionate name given to the women who worked in the forest during the Second World War as part of the women's Timber Corps

programme.title: Tyrant: The Rise of Adolf Hitler
programme.desc: A radical re-telling of the events that lead to the Second World War, focusing on the period between March 1938 and September 1939. Throughout the series, a team of leading young historians explain what Adolf Hitler was doing day by day, week by week during this period, looking at each moment through his eyes, and revealing how this tyrant brought the world to the edge of destruction. The first edition look at the six months between March 1938 and September 1938, and explores how Adolf Hitler began to drag the world towards a devastating war. The programme recalls how Hitler manipulated and played games with the people of Czechoslovakia and with the western powers of Britain and France to achieve his ends

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: A former miner is brought in as he is struggling to breathe, while Sister Jane is battling a seemingly never-ending stream of emergency patients in the hub. programme.desc: The story of the simultaneous hijacking of five passenger jets by a Palestinian militant group in 1970. programme.title: The Blitz: Britain on Fire
programme.desc: Michael Buerk, Angellica Bell and Rob Bell continue to tell the story of the Blitz, including the tales of young mothers searching for their babies in a maternity ward. Meanwhile, Margaret Johnson and three of her children are less than a mile from the docks when their air raid shelter receives a direct hit, and film star Mary Lawson makes a risky decision not to stay in one of the public shelters

programme.title: The Blitz: Britain on Fire
programme.desc: The documentary brings all the people's stories to a close, revealing the consequences of actress Mary Lawson's last-minute decision to stay above ground during the bombing, the moving end to the story of mother-of-six Margaret Johnson and how the staff and patients at the maternity hospital coped with the impact of the raids. The programme also considers the importance of morale during and after the Blitz - not just in Liverpool but across the entire country. Presented by Michael Buerk, Angellica Bell and Rob Bell
